Package etomica.species

Interface ISpecies

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISpeciesOriented
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Species, Species7SiteRigidSF6, SpeciesAceticAcid, SpeciesAlkane, SpeciesAlkaneEH, SpeciesAlkaneThiol, SpeciesAnthracene3site464, SpeciesAnthracene3site545, SpeciesEthanol, SpeciesHexane, SpeciesHSDimer, SpeciesMethane, SpeciesMethane, SpeciesMethanol, SpeciesMethanol, SpeciesN2, SpeciesN2B, SpeciesN2ShellModel, SpeciesOriented, SpeciesParacetamol, SpeciesPh3site464, SpeciesPh3site545, SpeciesPolyhedron, SpeciesSpheres, SpeciesSpheresCustom, SpeciesSpheresHetero, SpeciesSpheresMono, SpeciesSpheresRotating, SpeciesSpheresRotatingMolecule, SpeciesTraPPEAnthracene, SpeciesTraPPECO2, SpeciesTraPPENaphthalene, SpeciesTraPPEPhenanthrene, SpeciesTube, SpeciesWater3P, SpeciesWater3POriented, SpeciesWater4P, SpeciesWater4PCOM, SpeciesWater4POriented

    public interface ISpecies
    An ISpecies holds information about how to construct a molecule, and creates molecules on demand. In addition to actually creating molecules, ISpecies objects are often used as keys to pass and designate which species is of interest (for assigning potentials or setting the number of molecules in the box, for instance).
    See Also:
    Box, PotentialMaster

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        int getIndex​()
        Returns the index for this ISpecies, within the context of an Simulation. The index is the ISpecies' position in the array returned by SpeciesManager.getSpecies().

      • setIndex

        void setIndex​(int newIndex)
        Informs the ISpecies what its index should be. This should only be called by the SpeciesManager.

      • makeMolecule

        IMolecule makeMolecule​()
        Builds and returns the IMolecule of this ISpecies.

      • getAtomTypeCount

        int getAtomTypeCount​()
        Returns the number of child types of this group.

      • getAtomType

        AtomType getAtomType​(int index)
        Returns the child types of this group for the specified index.

      • getAtomTypes

        java.util.List<AtomType> getAtomTypes​()
        Get the list of AtomTypes that make up this Species.

        In general this list will be unmodifiable (will throw an exception if you attempt to modify it), instead you should use methods defined on the implementing class to add or remove AtomTypes.

        Returns:

      • initializeConformation

        void initializeConformation​(IMolecule molecule)
        Initializes the molecule's IAtoms in their standard arrangement. The overall position of the molecule may be changed by this method.
